intro: Heliophila tenuisiliqua, commonly known as the slender heliophyte, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a fibrous root system. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and soil organisms.
